title: Navy sailor charged in shooting death of Va. Beach teen
content:
VIRGINIA BEACH, Va. (WAVY) — A 22 year-old man has been arrested and charged in the shooting death of an 18-year-old girl from Virginia Beach.
Family members identified the victim as Aleigha Hawkingberry. Police say Alec Spencer Wagner, 22 of Chesapeake, is charged with involuntary manslaughter and reckless handling of a firearm.
Dispatchers received the emergency call at 9:52 p.m. Tuesday. When officers arrived on scene they found Hawkingberry suffering from a gunshot wound. She was pronounced dead at the scene.
Commander David Hecht of Airlant confirmed to 10 On Your Side that Wagner entered the Navy in May of 2014. He is currently stationed on the USS Harry S. Truman. He’s been assigned to the Truman since October 2014. His current rank is E-3 Seaman.
Family members said that Hawkingberry had just graduated from Landstown High School in June. She then started school at Tidewater Community College, with hopes of becoming a judge.
The teen’s aunt told 10 On Your Side that Hawkingberry loved her family, and will be remembered for her vibrant personality and artistic talents.
The family told 10 On Your Side that they do not know what happened.
A wake will be at H.D. Oliver Funeral Home on Laskin Road on Sunday from 4 to 6 p.m. A church service will be held at 11 a.m. Monday at St. John The Apostle Catholic Parish on Sandbridge Road.
The family of Hawkingberry has set up a GoFundMe in her memory.
Wagner is currently being held at Virginia Beach Correctional Center without bond.
Stay with WAVY.com for the updates to this developing story.
